Detailed Description

Mercury is the network communications library used in BigWorld.

Mercury provides both reliable and unreliable communications using UDP packets. The core class in Mercury is the Nub. This does most of the work, including sending and receiving packets, maintaining a time queue, and running the event loop. The Channel class can be used to provide reliable communications from one Nub to another. It provides a sliding window, with resends for reliability. The Bundle class provides a means for sending multiple messages at the same time, and grouping them efficiently between packets. The InterfaceMinder class is used for registering handlers for incoming messages.

Enumeration Type Documentation

enum Mercury::Reason

This enumeration contains reasons for Mercury errors, exceptions, and return codes.

Enumerator:
REASON_SUCCESS  No reason.
REASON_TIMER_EXPIRED  Timer expired.
REASON_NO_SUCH_PORT  Destination port is not open.
REASON_GENERAL_NETWORK  The network is stuffed.
REASON_CORRUPTED_PACKET  Got a bad packet.
REASON_NONEXISTENT_ENTRY  Wanted to call a null function.
REASON_WINDOW_OVERFLOW  Channel send window overflowed.
REASON_INACTIVITY  Channel inactivity timeout.
REASON_RESOURCE_UNAVAILABLE  Corresponds to EAGAIN.
REASON_CLIENT_DISCONNECTED  Client disconnected voluntarily.
REASON_TRANSMIT_QUEUE_FULL  Corresponds to ENOBUFS.
REASON_CHANNEL_LOST  Corresponds to channel lost.
REASON_SHUTTING_DOWN  Corresponds to shutting down app.
